title: How to Create a YouTube Subscription Link for Your Channel

steps.title: Go to https://www.youtube.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.youtube.com in a web browser. If you are not already signed in to your account, click the SIGN IN button at the top-right corner of the page to do so now. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click your profile icon and select View your channel.
steps.content: Click your profile icon and select View your channel . It's at the top-right corner of the page. This takes you to your channel.

steps.title: Copy the URL in the address bar.
steps.content: Copy the URL in the address bar. You can do this just by clicking the address at the top of your web browser and pressing Ctrl + C (PC and Chromebook) or ⌘ Command + C (Mac).

steps.title: Open a text editor on your computer.
steps.content: Open a text editor on your computer. If you're using Windows, use Notepad . On a Mac, open TextEdit in the Applications folder.

steps.title: Right-click or control-click the blank page and select Paste.
steps.content: Right-click or control-click the blank page and select Paste . Your YouTube channel's URL now appears in the text file.

steps.title: Add ?sub_confirmation=1 to the end of the URL.
steps.content: Add ?sub_confirmation=1 to the end of the URL. Don't insert a space, just start typing it after the last letter of the URL. For example, if the URL you pasted is https://www.youtube.com/@wikiHow , it should now look like https://www.youtube.com/@wikiHow?sub_confirmation=1 .

steps.title: Copy the new URL.
steps.content: Copy the new URL. You can do this by highlighting the URL and pressing ⌘ Command + C (Mac) or Ctrl + C (PC).

steps.title: Open the location where you want to insert the link.
steps.content: Open the location where you want to insert the link. This can be anywhere that allows you to enter a URL, including your website's HTML code , many social media profiles, and your email signature. If you're using a social media profile, you'll usually need to insert the link into a field labeled "Website" or "URL." See How to Create a Link Using HTML to learn how to add the link to your website's raw HTML code.

steps.title: Right-click or control-click the typing area and select Paste.
steps.content: Right-click or control-click the typing area and select Paste . Your YouTube channel's subscribe link now appears on the page. Be sure to save your code and/or update the page to save your changes.

steps.title: Open the YouTube app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app on your phone or tablet. It's the red rectangle icon with a white sideways triangle inside. You'll find it on the home screen or in the app drawer. [2] X Research source If you're using an Android, make sure you have an app that allows you to edit text. You can download any free text editor from the Play Store , such as Monospace, Google Docs, or Text Editor.

steps.title: Tap your profile photo.
steps.content: Tap your profile photo. It's at the top-right or bottom-right corner of the screen, depending on whether you're using an Android, iPhone, or iPad.

steps.title: Tap Your channel.
steps.content: Tap Your channel . It's near the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap the three-dot ⁝ menu and select Share.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot ⁝ menu and select Share . You'll see the three dots at the top-right corner. When you select Share , you'll see your phone or tablet's sharing options.

steps.title: Tap the Copy link option.
steps.content: Tap the Copy link option. This may just be called Copy on some devices. This copies your channel's URL to your clipboard.

steps.title: Open your Notes app or a text editor.
steps.content: Open your Notes app or a text editor. If you're using an iPhone or iPad, use the Notes app , which looks like a yellow, white, and gray sheet of notepaper. If you're using an Android, you can use Google Docs or any other app that allows you to type.

steps.title: Tap and hold the typing area and select Paste.
steps.content: Tap and hold the typing area and select Paste . The copied URL will appear on the page.

steps.title: Add ?sub_confirmation=1 to the end of the URL.
steps.content: Add ?sub_confirmation=1 to the end of the URL. Don't insert a space, just start typing it after the last letter of the URL. [3] X Research source For example, if the URL you pasted is https://www.youtube.com/@wikiHow , it should now look like https://www.youtube.com/@wikiHow?sub_confirmation=1 .

steps.title: Copy the new complete URL.
steps.content: Copy the new complete URL. To do this, tap and hold part of the URL, drag the sliders to highlight the entire URL in a different color, and then tap Copy on the menu. You may have to tap and hold the highlighted link to see the Copy option on the menu.

steps.title: Open the location where you want to insert the link.
steps.content: Open the location where you want to insert the link. This can be anywhere that allows you to enter a URL, including your website's HTML code or social media profile. If you're using a social media profile, you'll usually need to insert the link into a field labeled "Website" or "URL."

steps.title: Tap and hold the typing area and select Paste.
steps.content: Tap and hold the typing area and select Paste . The direct URL to subscribe to your channel now appears in this location. Be sure to save your code and/or update the page to save your changes.
